title: The Churning
info: Shyam Benegal | India | 1976 | 134 minutes | Hindi with English subtitles
description: Now restored in 4K, The Churning is a landmark film that tells the story of a rural cooperative milk movement in Gujarat, India. It was one of Smita Patil’s earliest roles, leading to a series of collaborations with director Shyam Benegal, many of which examined feudalism, gender and the politics of mobilization. The financing was raised by 500,000 farmers who contributed two rupees each to the final budget. With powerful performances by Girish Karnad, Smita Patil, and Naseeruddin Shah, The Churning is a compelling tale of local grassroots initiatives.
strand: LIFF SPOTLIGHT – Smita Patil: Spice and Fire
